channel.title: Business News
channel.description: Latest headlines for business news around the world.

item.title: McDonald's teams up with Mariah Carey for holiday promotion in latest celebrity collaboration
item.description: McDonald's is aiming to juice its holiday sales through a collaboration with pop star Mariah Carey.

item.title: Amazon-backed EV start-up Rivian set to go public, targets $66.5 billion valuation
item.description: Rivian, which is backed by Amazon and Ford, has attracted intense interest from investors looking to capitalize on the fast-growing EV market.

item.title: Only 28% of New York office workers are back in the office
item.description: A new survey suggests that remote work will endure long after January and reduce the demand for office space in New York.

item.title: Op-ed: The future of socially responsible investing is in female hands
item.description: As sustainable investing continues to grow, women are taking the lead as investors, industry decision-makers and corporate executives.

item.title: 5 things to know before the stock market opens Wednesday
item.description: U.S. stock futures fell Wednesday after this week's second major inflation report showed consumer prices soaring last month.

item.title: Southwest and British Airways fuel deals send Velocys shares surging by over 40%
item.description: The agreements relate to a planned biorefinery in Mississippi.

item.title: American Airlines pilots' union rejects holiday bonus pay, seeks permanent changes
item.description: American Airlines pilots' union turned down a company offer to pay 50% more for holiday trips.

item.title: Bentley, the high-priced British luxury car brand, is seeing record sales
item.description: Bentley cars are luxurious, powerful and expensive. The brand is enjoying some of the strongest sales and profits in its 100-year history.

item.title: The best cruises of 2022, according to U.S. News & World Report
item.description: In U.S. News & World Report ranking of the "best" cruise lines of 2022, two cruise lines, Viking and Disney, topped all but one category.

item.title: NFL fines Aaron Rodgers and Packers for Covid violations
item.description: The NFL fined the Green Bay Packers $300,000 and quarterback Aaron Rodgers $14,650 for violating the league's Covid policies.

item.title: AMC's profitability hangs on the domestic box office topping $2 billion in Q4. Here's what would need to happen
item.description: AMC said if the box-office grosses from October, November and December hit $2 billion, it would be able to post positive cash flow in the fourth quarter.

item.title: Jim Cramer says General Electric breaking up into 3 companies is the right move
item.description: The eventual breakup of the U.S. industrial conglomerate may be symbolically somber, the "Mad Money" host said, but it's the right financial move.

item.title: Roblox founder and CEO: Our business plan 17 years ago predicted the rise of metaverse
item.description: Roblox is "really focused on the innovation to drive and shepherd this vision of what some people call the metaverse ... forward," CEO David Baszucki told CNBC.

item.title: Cramer's lightning round: The best cannabis play is Innovative Industrial Properties
item.description: "Mad Money" host Jim Cramer rings the lightning round bell, which means he's giving his answers to callers' stock questions at rapid speed.

item.title: Jim Cramer recommends selling some stock to raise cash until the market is less confusing
item.description: "Sooner or later the market will make up its mind, and then you can make up yours," the "Mad Money" host said, lamenting the lack of clarity on Wall Street.

item.title: NIH director urges vaccinated Americans to get Covid booster shots to curb breakthrough infections over holidays
item.description: NIH Director Dr. Francis Collins cited data from Israel that showed the waning effectiveness of Pfizer's Covid vaccine against the delta variant.

item.title: Labor union representing TSA and other federal workers urges White House to postpone vaccine deadline until 2022
item.description: The American Federation of Government Employees has asked the Biden administration to push back a deadline for federal workers to be vaccinated until 2022.

item.title: Krispy Kreme revenue beats estimates as doughnut chain flexes pricing power
item.description: Krispy Kreme's third-quarter revenue climbed 18%, boosted by higher prices on its fresh doughnuts, helping the chain offset rising commodity and labor costs.

item.title: Pfizer asks FDA to authorize Covid booster shots for all adults
item.description: If approved, it would significantly increase the number of people eligible to get the extra shots.

item.title: 'Squid Game' season 2 is 'in discussions, but not confirmed yet,' Netflix says
item.description: Netflix is eyeing a season two for its popular series "Squid Game," but has yet to confirm production.

item.title: Boeing delivered 27 planes in October, airlines still waiting on new Dreamliners
item.description: American Airlines chief revenue officer Vasu Raja said the deliveries of the Dreamliner will set the pace of its international expansion.

item.title: NASA delays astronaut moon landing to 2025
item.description: NASA on Tuesday delayed its plans to return astronauts to the surface of the moon, announcing the agency is targeting 2025 for a crewed landing.

item.title: Pfizer CEO says people who spread misinformation on Covid vaccines are 'criminals'
item.description: People who spread misinformation on Covid-19 vaccines are "criminals," Pfizer CEO Albert Bourla said, "because they have literally cost millions of lives."

item.title: GE CEO Larry Culp says it will move as quickly as it can to split up company but will do it right
item.description: General Electric CEO Larry Culp said the company will move as quickly as it can to split up the company but will focus on doing it right.

item.title: Sales of pregnancy tests are on the rise. That's good news for retailers like Walmart and Target, Bank of America says
item.description: A rising number of millennial couples say they are trying to have a baby over the next 12 months, according to a Bank of America survey.

item.title: Panera Bread announces SPAC investment, will return to the public markets through an IPO
item.description: Panera Bread is preparing to go public again through an initial public offering.

item.title: Inspire Brands launches a ghost kitchen as more restaurants lean into virtual restaurants
item.description: Alliance Kitchen will allow customers to order from both third-party aggregator platforms and the brands' apps.

item.title: Peloton unveils Guide, a strength training program that connects to your TV
item.description: As Peloton grapples with finding growth, the connected fitness company announced it's launching a strength training product called the Peloton Guide.

item.title: Shares of Hertz fall 9.8% on first day of Nasdaq relisting
item.description: Hertz said the pricing of the upsized offering of 44.52 million shares will be $29 – the high end of its previously targeted range.

item.title: U.S. judge rules that United's employee vaccine mandate can continue
item.description: Six United Airlines employees sued the company over the company's policy to put unpaid employees on leave if they don't get vaccinated.
